* Iron Raptor heard Arcangle enter the room but didn�t turn and look at him, 
keeping her optics on the ground as she thought about the mission ahead. She 
had received the transmission from Feline and had deactivated her com-link, 
now dwelling on just what they needed to take with them to recover the 
missing bots.
She growled low in thought, though, her thoughts were interrupted my the 
presence of Arcangle and his words.
Iron Raptor thought about his question for a moment, turning it around in 
her mind.
It was fairly risky to go out and look for the Autobots, half of the problem 
being that they didn�t know where they were. And she knew that the Predacons 
OR Alliance would attack any bots that came across their path, making it 
very dangerous to try and locate something.
Iron Raptor slid off the tabletop and faced the projections of the missing 
Maximals, then turning towards the large window that looked out into the 
larger of the two Conference Rooms. With a sigh she walked over to the 
window and put a hand on the glass, her mind still dwelling on the mission 
at hand but also Arcangels question.
Finally she came to a conclusion.*

� Yes. But when I get back and not until then.�

* She traced her finger along the glass and tilted her head to the side.*

� The Ark is extremely damaged and needs heavy repair. When I get back I�ll 
send you out to look for the Autobots, but then half the Maximal forces and 
myself will begin repairs. I want that ship completely functional before I 
even allow those bots anywhere near it. Understand?�

* Iron Raptor then turned her head and looked over at Arcangel, then turning 
her optics towards Silver Sting and Hot Rod.*

� You two can go with him when I return, if you want. Otherwise you�ll be 
repairing the Ark with the rest of us. The choice is yours.�

* But then she turned and faced the reflective surface of the window again, 
her finger still tracing invisible lines on the glass. But then she heard 
another set of footsteps enter the room, softer and more collected�Feline. 
But then she heard them slow a bit, thinking that it must be her becoming a 
ware of the male bots in the room. Something that she would have to get 
over.
She then felt the fembots� optics on her, tilting her head to finally see 
Feline approach her.
But this time her expression was just as blank as it was when she was 
speaking to Arcangle, Silver Sting and Hot Rod�but it was a little more 
relaxed with a kind sense about her. After all, Feline was a little jittery 
about around the men and she wanted her to feel relaxed around her at 
least.*

� No. You won�t be going. What I want you to do is set up a small medical 
unit in the CR room for when we get back.  Some of the damage that those two 
bots may have taken might be too extensive for just the CR chambers to 
handle, and I need you to treat those wounds that the chambers can�t.  Any 
questions?�

* Iron Raptor then turned back to the window and crossed her arms in front 
of her chest, simply waiting for Feline to ask any questions that she might 
need to know the answers to.*
